Hl-PsGrJG4wjQA-9NdqCyg.text: Great food, great, friendly service. Highly recommend this eatery. Wifey had megaberries waffles, I had strawberry waffles. Both dishes were out of this world. And the best part, NOT HEAVY, like most other waffles I've eaten.

-m3QHmp-JjIPKz9H75UZjQ.text: Yum! I loved the option for savory and sweet waffles. If you are a waffle person over a pancake person, this is the place for you. The waffles were not especially tasty but they have a variety if combinations. The waffles were definitely fresh and they have great selection of juices and coffee. I recommend this place! Make sure to make reservations or come early. It is not open all day and it can get super busy. My favorite is the southern and the country benedict. In the summer, it will also be nice to sit outside because it is a nice area!

wRZEm-CN5N8oDdjin80d-g.text: No one seemed to be in charge as the wait staff were running around crazy and disorganized; no bussers, no runners.  Tables sat empty and dirty & food sat at pickup window.  It wasn't their fault, they seemed set up for failure.  Food was sub-par, not worth the 50min wait (we were told 20min).  Seems like a new restaurant but they need to go back to the drawing board with a direction and management on how to handle brunches on the weekend brunches.  2 stars b/c of the coffee.

WMdxZ05ybWPDdFUDg4M6XA.text: This was my first time eating at any of their restaurants. My girlfriend and I went to their downtown location on a Wednesday for breakfast and were seated immediately. We were able to walk there, but the location is very convenient if you drive and have to park nearby. We ordered the BC Breakfast and Sausage Gravy Waffles- both came out quickly and were absolutely delicious. The portions were large and we both wound up taking leftovers home. Our waitress was awesome, very attentive and helpful with recommendations and didn't hover between checking on us. We will definitely be back again. Try the chicken cranberry sausage as a side, it was perfect with our meals.

iyWSpmNIW5QGct-FSb4_Kw.text: I built my own waffle- it was Oreo cookie-infused waffle batter with cream cheese filling, vanilla ice cream, and chocolate sauce on top. It was delicious. The waffle was $7 and each infusion/topping was $1.50. My boyfriend had one of the May specials, the "Waffles Frolic" which broke a waffle into 4 parts, each with different toppings. The sausage gravy and the bacon/cheese/sour cream waffles were the best. The atmosphere is more like a chain restaurant but the food was good. There is no outdoor seating and only street parking.

_qaPJJnPcQ7YmIz6mVdMOw.text: Disorganized!!! We have been sitting at our table for 12 minutes without drinks!  Our drinks came out two minutes before our food. There are multiple tables with dirty dishes on them and they keep moving them from table to table. The food is good, but they need to figure out how to properly run a restaurant! Working in the restaurant business for years to have a successful organization you need the following : bus staff to clear tables, food runners, a manager on the floor, more staff. A place to have staff process billing. Drinks should all be in one spot not in random spots. Was the dishwasher even working? Coffee being given in travel cups!. I witnessed a waitress have three dirty tables to take a cigarette break.  The women working in the kitchen is AMAZING!!!

XcJbPQiFBr045cBruDP_WA.text: Was visiting Pittsburgh and read the reviews before going.  They were quick to get us seated even though it was a busy Saturday morning.  I tried the Benny and it was very good! Very savory. The service was quick, I did have to ask for refills but they were very accommodating. I ended up also ordering the Megaberry because I wanted something sweet and saw numerous Megaberries go on by from where I was seated. I will it was worth coming to.  I would like to try the other waffles, hopefully on the next visit.

C3J_jOq6rCOa0NPf1cPdCA.text: I was really excited to have some quality chicken and waffles after having the KFC version.  We went here for lunch and the service was great.  Everyone there was friendly and the food came out relatively fast. The food left a little to be desired though.  The waffles were light and fluffy, however did not have a very pronounce flavor. The candied nuts overtook the flavor and the chicken was nothing more than frozen chicken fingers that you would expect from a bar.  For $13 I expected a little more.

gJzjfA41J0T_asYqbU6swA.text: We went to Waffles, INCaffeinated on a Sunday morning- six young kids in tow. The service was quick, the staff was friendly and the food was delicious. The kids had kids' waffles, my husband had chicken and waffles and I had the funky monkey. It was all delectable! We will be back again.

-KUX0-7jHniZ3L0efZenfg.text: I am not one to like my food mixing, but went to an event here and had to try something outside of my comfort zone. I highly recommend it

Dzicga0cQHug0rth-RpLJA.text: This place had great value and quality product. I think the fact that their waffles aren't too sweet makes it a better vehicle for all the different things they put on top. When we got here we were seated immediately and our drink orders were taken right away. The place is clean and bright. I ordered the "Benny" and the amount of crab that came on it was substantial. My husband ordered the country Benedict and it was a lot of food. Mine was lighter which I enjoyed, my husband's was flavorful and although it was a heavier dish, the chicken was crispy and everything was well done. Both dishes were about $13 which I thought was a good deal. Definitely worth checking out if you're in the area.

4VT7p67xMqqtP5d7MzLPww.text: MEHHH.. super disappointed. This place was recommended by a hotel staff member when we asked where we can get a quick breakfast. The wait time to sit was 45 mins to an 1 hour. No biggie to me, I just was short on time and placed an order to go thinking I didn't have to wait as long. WRONG. After 40 mins of standing by the hostess area where I placed my order (breakfast magic I believed I ordered?), I asked her when my food would be ready. "Oh it's ready now, let me go get it" *eye roll* Sooooooooo you knew my order was ready to go but left me waiting how long extra since it was made just for me to bring it up to youuu???? So annoying. I had max 5 mins to eat the thing once I was able to sit outside by a bench and once I opened it, it ended up being a lousy regular waffle with a simple egg and some bacon crumpling on top. Cold obviously and the overall taste was just blah. I wasted 40 mins for this? A waffle takes literally 2-3 mins to make on a waffle maker and an egg another 2 mins.. I threw most of it out. I feel nausea now just thinking about the taste.

erOQmyOrE5dmvqo2HfvACw.text: Great waffles!!! Loved their home made fries!!! Definitely the place for waffle lovers!

xkzWN0VOYnNOLPVjnnG_7Q.text: Great breakfast! great service! Easy to find for ppl out of the area!  Thanks to yelp for helping us find this great place

V_9G9oBX70St3kXlEwQeJQ.text: The location I went to opened maybe a month ago. They seem to have all the kinks worked out already. We were greeted and seated as soon as we walked in, even though they had a lunch crowd. The man who seated us even pulled my chair out. The server was knowledgeable about the menu and gave great suggestions. The food was amazing. My waffle was cooked perfectly as was the egg on top. The presentation was nice as well. I will definitely be going back.

wotYxm7bkMA9oHL65up7jw.text: In town for the weekend, staying at the Renaissance Hotel. This was within walking distance and we didn't want the expensive buffet breakfast/brunch at the hotel. So glad we found Waffles Inc. We had a lovely and quiet Sunday morning walk and a delicious breakfast about which we are still talking!

P-3J0qxABpon4aLEZ8tkHQ.text: I am rating as 3 star because I feel the overall experience was average.  Obviously by the name I was expecting the strong points to be waffles and coffee.  4 people ordered waffles.  A few thought theirs were really good and unique.  A few felt they were good but not exceptional.  2 ordered coffee.  1 a specialty drink that was ok and the other just a black coffee that was actually not good at all. Decor was nothing special.  Service was fine.  Summary for us....it was ok. Would not go out if our way to go back though.

Y3Men7hYM3vcR0BFbv8eJg.text: I don't like waffles but the magic breakfast is amazing and Olga the manager is amazing

photos.caption: Photo of Waffles, INCaffeinated - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

DYeI2NIt5svKaDPXzTW9YQ.text: Waffles, INC perfectly fills it's niche in the Downtown breakfast market. It's a fun place with excellent food and great service at an affordable price.   We had The Benny (their take on eggs Benedict with ham, egg, crab & hollandaise in a waffle) and the Southern Benedict (fried chicken, sausage gravy & egg). Both were excellent, but the Southern edged out the regular Benedict for our favorite. The sausage gravy was superb, and the chicken was perfectly fried and crispy. Additionally, the coffee was some of the best I've had.  We were greeted warmly, seated promptly, and our server was polite and attentive. The food arrived hot and quickly.   All in all, this is a great place for an affordable, casual breakfast when you're downtown and not in the mood to spend $80-100 on brunch, but you still want a delicious meal at a place where the spoons aren't greasy. We'll be going back again soon!

bMa4JNAGEsmnsKlhHSm-Ow.text: Our first time to Pittsburgh and first time to Waffles ncaffinated. We ate there on a Sunday morning after Thanksgiving. We were greeted by a friendly hostess who seated us immediately. Our server, Jack, greeted us just as promptly for our drink order. His attention to us continued at perfect intervals during our meal. Forward the end of our meal my husband ordered decaf coffee. Jack took his order, went to the back,then came back to explain they don't get many requests for decaf and they like to brew their coffee fresh, and it will be about a 3 minute wait. We very much appreciated his communication and explanation! The kitchen window is open to the dining area. I was able to watch and hear the four gentleman in the kitchen cooking and preparing food. The lead cook was very polite and respectful to the other cooks. He used please and thank you. He was never frazzled or loud. The restaurant filled up quickly after our arrival and several orders were put in at the same time.  My husband ordered waffles with sausage and gravy. The gravy had a sage flavor that was unexpected and delicious. I ordered waffles and chicken. The chicken was delicious, but the waffle had a bitter flavor probably from the pecans in the waffle and atop the waffle. One son ordered the Breakfast magic waffle with bacon, egg, cheese and a side of home fries. Our youngest son ordered The Carnivore Omlette- three different meats and cheese. Also accompanied by a side of "home fries". OH, for the LOVE of home fries! These home fries were amazing! They used purple potatoes, sweet potatoes, and a white potato that has a bit of purple in it, onion and green pepper. Each was chunked in perfect bite size, flavored with salt and pepper and other seasonings. Each meal was served on large heavy square or rectangular plates. They were garnished decoratively and pleasing to the eye.  The restaurant decor was the perfect shade of orange, not too bright! It was accented simply with black and stainless steel. A few simple breakfast photos hung on the wall above the kitchen pass through. The refreshing simplicity of the decor we were pleasantly surprised by how beautiful the food presentation was. Well done!

6aAT2AEuZ0n86pnEVu9xVA.text: We got the Fosters waffle and French Toast. Wasn't sure that the French Toast was going to taste like bread even tho it looks like a waffle. Taste is good.  Would suggest adding a topping to it to give yourself more variety unless you're a traditionalist.  Servers are pretty attentive even though they appear to be a little under-staffed. Jack, our server was great!  Shout out to the hostess (Maddie) that was running around a lot taking names and cleaning off the tables!!! Would have given it four stars if the wait for the food wasn't as long as it took (30 mins).  FYI we got to place at 10:05am and got seated around 10:33am and they said it would be a 20 minute wait to be seated. Would recommend visiting!!!

7GVpGL8MdBrrd8ku-2WoyA.text: While our food was okay (I got the waffle Benedict), the service was pretty terrible. Our waiter seemed confused about absolutely everything, and we had other waiters/kitchen staff checking in to either help us, or clarify things on our order. To top it all off, our waiter gave us someone else's credit card, and I had to chase him around the restaurant to give it back.

bLPLCeqnUv2UNvYyuP--pw.text: The food is really good, definitely worth it. I got the BC breakfast, and a waffle which was super filling! I really appreciate that their homefries are made with 3 different types of potatoes (purple, yellow, and sweet potato). Yes it's a little on the expensive side, but I think you'll be really satisfied with the food. This place loses a star because I can't fathom why a place would willingly have orange walls. It's like sitting in an orange hi-lighter.

ZbcmKV7llbLvPatJzMjRTw.text: The downtown Waffles INC is always a solid option for breakfast or for lunch. I've gone a couple of times for lunch and have never had a hard time getting a seat. The waffles are always cooked to perfection and the omelettes are always a great option. I like to go with the Southwest omelette as there is a gooey cheese center to it and is great with hot sauce. The side of homefries is enormous, so I prefer to go with the roasted tomatoes because they go good with the peppers in the omelette and are a lighter option to a mid day break. The food is a bit expensive for waffles and breakfast food, but it is always quality so it balances out.

zEeHNtXpwn5th61KufbWXA.text: Clean, service was quick , options are great and the Food tasted decently good but nothing I'd brag about . Very close to some of the downtown hotels so it's convenient and affordable . However , compared to other breakfast joints available in Pittsburgh it would not be my first stop.

Bjj_YfnE0ZMrdtOM12RY3w.text: I got to check out the new Waffles, Inc location downtown for an Elite event. It was great! I have never been to any of their locations, so I was super stoked to check this out. They brought out a TON of sample plates for everyone to try, and then we got to pick an item from the menu. We tried savory, sweet, and seasonal waffles, some vegan and vegetarian options, and their home fries. Everything was really good. I ordered the chicken and waffles, and my husband got the Caprese omelet. They were both awesome! My chicken and waffles was HUGE, so I had leftovers for the next day which is always a plus. I may have even eaten them cold, and they were still delicious. I will definitely be back!

gz4tDkacdh_gOuPXBoQC0Q.text: This was a wonderful surprise.  My husband and I are in Pittsburgh for a few days. I had noticed this location during my walking tours of the city and today we stopped in for breakfast.   The staff was welcoming and informative about the menu and the special of the day.  We both ordered the Breakfast Magic waffle with bacon, cheddar cheese shreds, green onions and sour cream.   When the waffles arrived, we were offered three syrups:  regular, vanilla and bourbon.  We tried the vanilla and the bourbon: both were delicious!   I am only sorry we waited to try this restaurant on our last day downtown.

Waited 20 min and was seated.   Then we ordered right away and waited another 40 min to get 2 waffles and French toast. Food was decent but not worth the wait. Staff friendly enough but clearly understaffed.

pnrIKHxc-1lk0gsm-l4zZw.text: Service was not the greatest. The breakfast tacos were also subpar. The waffles and gravy were ok, but nothing to go back for. Not a fan of the brown gravy.

En-mgHPJunh0_ck_dLqq8Q.text: Amazing breakfast!! Too much food but that isn't their fault. Everything we ordered was excellent but the stand outs for me were the home fries (great flavor and perfectly cooked), the eggs and waffles. The service was spot on from the initial "good morning" when we walked in the door to the attentiveness and wonderful attitude of our server. Best breakfast I've had in years.

6wCJ5TrHlVwaHxApYUZU_A.text: It was okay, fine, meh. I got a gluten-free benny waffle - for which there is an upcharge of course, but although this the most expensive waffle on the menu, I received half of a soggy waffle with one hard poached and one already broken egg. The crab was good - the hollandaise was fine. It was edible - kind of.  It was busy which I found confusing due to the experience it seemed like myself and everyone else was having, my only explanation for that would be that it is walking distance to many downtown hotels and thus a go-to for out of towners.  Overall it lacks in service, ambience (not that I expecting any) and attention to detail. Also, didn't love that there were so many flies inside.

rjZv7gQzk74o95xlPKQuHw.text: I've been to the South Side location a couple of times where I've eaten the Funky Monkey waffle (bananas, chocolate chips, peanut butter and more) as well as chicken and waffle. Both were super delicious.  This morning after grabbing coffee at a local spot a coworker was hungry for brekkie and asked if I'd want to split something. When she said WafflesINC I couldn't refuse. We decided on the Megaberry waffle which is a waffle stuffed with raspberries and blueberries. Talk about a taste explosion for the mouth. Woah! It's also topped with more berries, whipped cream and vanilla sauce. The waffles are cooked to perfection with a lightness that doesn't make them hard or crunchy.  Splitting this was definitely the way to go since it's pretty filling. Yay for having a location downtown though I'm not sure it's good for the old waistline! The interior is orange and I mean orange! Orange fast food style booth seating and not much in the way of decor at all. Very basic. But hey the food is good and that's alright by me.

2Cynm88094PK8hnOKfvOpw.text: The best dining out experience I've had in recent memory. Great food and service, friendly and prompt. Strongly recommend.

SwqjnowTyNMqhclTAatjww.text: What a great place! I've been to the waffles INCafeinated in Beaver and was excited to try this new location. Upon walking in, I must say I love the location and the orange on the walls! What a welcoming space. The owner is so nice and just seems to be looking to serve his customers. He also has a great staff that was hard at work and very efficient.   I tried both the vegan waffles with berries and the southern waffles that had chicken, fried egg and sausage gravy. The vegan was so good and I think I will be back to just have full order of that! What a great surprise. I tried the southern style waffles, but truthfully, I've had the chicken and waffles before and so I wanted to try something new with the gravy and egg but just the plain is probably my favorite. Although the gravy and egg version was delicious there is something so good about the plain chicken and waffles with the bourbon syrup that is just wonderful.   Well done on the new location and I am looking forward to going more often that it is conveniently located in the old Kauffman's/Macy building.

TSgRRSuW8wYXWkakF9GvUg.text: We had a great time! The staff is so friendly and the owner came by and introduced himself. It was a great touch! We ate so many waffles I felt like I was going to turn into one! Everything that we had was exceptionally tasty. They even have a waffle with toppings that make it taste like thanksgiving dinner! The chai tea was also very delicious. We will be back in the future for more waffles... yum!

kaFyH1isSVjJxO2P7rtviw.text: Went to Waffles INCAFFEINATED for a yelp elite event where were able to try a much of different items of the menu. The real sleeper item was the home fries. Multicolored potatoes with peppers and onions crispy and fluffy to perfection! They also offered three types of syrup: classic, bourbon (very bourbon-y!) and vanilla (simple syrup) The gumbo waffle with ice cream was a bit strange to learn about but very good! Also all of the sweet waffles were nice... but again how could you go wrong?! The reason I'm giving four stars is two fold:  Firstly the waffles were not very crispy. They were more soft and one textured. I would have loved a nice crispy exterior.  Secondly, the Benny (my off the menu pick for the night) was more bland than I would have liked. The hollandaise was very rich but one noted. That and the creamy egg and soft waffle led to a less dynamic experience than I would have hoped. Subbing in bacon for the ham and adding some pepper or chives or something would have upped the dish. They also offer a variety of espresso drinks but do not have a real espresso machine so they aren't great but hey do offer almond and soy milk! They also served a vegan waffle which was very good! I would never have thought it was vegan!

But it was rubbery, terrible and tho they advertise vegan, they don't have vegan butter. Not sure - but I highly doubt - their maple syrup is real maple syrup. It didn't have the taste or texture of it. The only saving grace is here my server was super sweet, nice and accommodating. I guess if you're in to junk food all the time - this is the place for you. wrT2JsUda1y6RBKsQVTC-w.text: I had the sausage gravy on the waffles and my brother got the waffles and chicken.  We had a side of the chicken cranberry sausage. We both loved our breakfast and the sausage was delicious. We plan to go back tomorrow with friends. Service was pretty good.

n90qyK1e612by7LAjPiEXw.text: Best Brunch place in Carson nearby area!!! Waffles with fresh berries and special coffee ingredients.

Qy08QCynSqIa1CnHHM06Qg.text: I came here for breakfast with my parents one Saturday- late morning. We were quickly greeted and seated. The place was not busy so we didn't have to wait (unlike the Southside location). Our waiter was very kind and explained the specials and menu highlights to us. Once we ordered, our food came out quickly and everything was hot and fresh. This place continues to be one of my fave breakfast spots! Again, the added bonus was being able to walk right in and be seated without a reservation at this downtown location!

Q66iiiqDR09ovi6Y81LEvA.text: My husband and I recently took a trip to Pittsburgh for a wedding. We went here for brunch on a Saturday. We were pleasantly surprised to find that there was no wait and the staff were very friendly. I ordered the BLT with an egg, which came with house-made chips with "ranch dust."  The ranch dust was too salty for my taste, but the sandwich was delicious! My husband ordered the fried chicken with waffles, which was yummy as well. The chicken was perfectly fried. Overall, we had a good dining experience and would recommend this restaurant to our friends who are looking for brunch in a pinch!

1mORdq5GYvr9qhWP8qWd2A.text: tl;dr I'd rather eat at Denny's. I received a cold overcooked omelette, paid extra for toast and it was quite expensive! The home-fries are a variety of root vegetables which is actually pretty neat. But they were cooked them long before I got em, so they sort of had a hollow texture to them, and weren't appetizing.  Two breakfasts, with a side of toast and really really bitter undrinkable coffee. Like 36 bucks.

ixPAp5uBYdQtM3AacFvOcA.text: First experience here was a pretty good one. I am doing keto currently and there were definitely options on the menu I could have. I asked questions about what ingredients they used in their food and the waitress politely went to ask the kitchen staff. She was prompt and attentive and the other food that my friends got looked really good. It also came out pretty quickly. The only thing I wasn't a fan of was the fact that our checks were brought promptly after we finished our breakfast, which we didn't ask for. I get that Saturday mornings they probably like to get people in and out, but some people like to take their time and catch up.

jP-psipR5SBBd1I5K4wZFA.text: The menu states that they can make gluten free anything, yet the server did not say how much the upcharge was, I noticed a $3 charge for the make your own waffle.  When I asked about it, the server was extremely rude and terse.   Then I noticed on the open door a sign that the credit card machine was not working and to walk to an ATM, which we did not see because of the open door.  I asked for the manager and she was robotic and really did not seem to care about our complaints.  At the end, the server finally tells us that the machine was down.... instead of when we came in.  While my companions said the food was okay, it certainly was not worth the price or the substandard service.

5QWG8PtBA3R3mv7x7pCIQA.text: I really try over and over to like this place, but they just take forever to get food out. The food itself isn't bad, but I can't come here at lunch or really ever because it takes over an hour for them to make food. If you have tons of time, try it out.

ibow_Ool4J74Np0FFu8sQg.text: This place was very mediocre. We were there on a busy morning and there was a long line to wait, so we took our meals to go. For a place, that specializes in waffles, they were pretty plain. Nothing special or out of the ordinary.

nPEdrHlqZMbNLszBDT8jaQ.text: I've been to the south side location several times but was excited to have the opportunity to test out the new downtown location. Downtown Pittsburgh is definitely lacking more casual breakfast options and this place fits the bill.  While the waffles and wait staff are awesome the only thing that really throws me off is the intense traffic cone orange paint on the wall. Not that should sway you away from coming here but I was totally weirded out by bright orange walls. Orange is just a weird color in a restaurant to begin with but hey I'm not the designer or the painter. I'm just someone that eats food and writes long reviews that who knows if you're reading at this point. I'll say this come for the waffles stay away from the orange walls and you'll have a good morning.

KyT0LljktEHLGWoLrAkUXg.text: Came to this location for lunch on a weekday.  Ordered the veggie omelette and chose the fruit salad option as my side.  Been to another location before, so it was nice already having an idea of what to expect.  Friend ordered their Benny and asked for the crab meat to be on the side.  What's hot - Layout.  Decent waiting space.  It's the front corner of the restaurant with seating benches, which is helpful.  This location is in the heart of downtown, which guarantees rush hours, which is why I'm happy there is a decent waiting area.   - Menu.  I like the variety.  There are many breakfast options- sweet and savory options, crepes, omelettes, fruity options, etc...  it's nice to have options to accommodate what mood I'm in and/or what type of breakfast food I'm craving.   - Quality.  Yummers!  The pico de gallo was fresh and spicy, which added to the flavor.  The salsa wasn't overly spicy, but enough of a kick, which was great.  The crab meat that was on my friend's Benny was delicious- not too sweet or briney.  There's a good amount of crab meat, too- around the size of your fist.  The eggs were nicely poached and the yolks runny.  The fruit salad was pretty fresh.  The fruits were pieces oranges, pineapple, strawberries, grapes, apple, and pear.  With the exception of the pineapple, the rest of the fruit seemed fresh.  I also didn't taste the extra sweetness of added sugar in the fruit salad, which I liked. - Take away.  While I was waiting, a couple customers came in to pick up their orders.  They only waited a few minutes to pay and for their food to be wrapped up.  From what I could tell, it looked like the food was prepared fresh and wasn't just sitting around.  It's nice to see this, because it's an additional option.    What's not - Price.  Many of their dishes don't come with a side, which I don't like.  Sides cost extra. - Order mistake.  I ordered the veggie omelette and that's definitely not what I got.  I'm not certain how there was any confusion.  I didn't bring up the mistake, which is my bad.  At least it was yummy. - Be prepared for it to be busy, because of the location.  Final answer Plan on coming back again.

BsOLQMoqUOZSnoNQhCOMXQ.text: I LOVE Waffles INCaffeinated. My first couple of experiences were at the South Side location, but the Downtown one is much more convenient for me. The food quality is great and I always love a good latte from this place. I'm giving five stars because I've always been truly satisfied with the food. The one thing that could be improved is the service.  The past 2 times I have gone there (both in April 2019) the restaurant has seemed a bit understaffed. I had to wait about 20 minutes each time, which wasn't unexpected because I went at peak hours. However, the person taking names was so overwhelmingly busy, he didn't take out names down for about 10 minutes and we were just waiting there confused for a while. The communication between the staff and the customers could be improved, but as always, the food was great.

jRW6tjM0W58QyE6e8_0Sag.text: I really wanted to like this place. It's a new place in the city. When you walk in the place, it doesn't appear that they have moved in completely. Even though the place has been opened for over a month.  We decided to go here to try something different out. Everything is about the Waffle, and that's a great idea. But maybe provide a better-made waffle, and chicken to go with it. The waffles easily could have been from Sam's Club, along with Tyson's chicken.  The service was friendly, and good at her job. But she mentioned that the syrup they had two different bottles. One in which was bourben syrup, and the other was regular. Well the syrup came out like it was water. I've never seen any type of syrup come out so thin before.   I had the chicken and waffles. The waitress said I would love this place the best. But I didn't. It had zero taste to it. If it wasn't for the pecans, it would have been like eating air. I will not go back.

Photo of Waffles, INCaffeinated - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

eWgGTgOagRWuwLEODsHsrw.text: Recently attended a yelp elite event here.  I was surprised to find out that they have a pretty extensive menu, and beyond breakfast waffles they have inventive "brinner" (breakfast-dinner) waffle creations.  Our servers were quick, and exceptionally friendly they really wanted us to have a good time. My Yelp friends and I really enjoyed our experience and everyone seemed to love the food. I really enjoyed the sampler waffle plate- getting to try a bit of everything. Having both savory and sweet combination is genius. The waffles are really fluffy and flavorful here.  For my own meal, I was really undecided between sweet and savory, so it was great that they had options for satisfying both cravings!  The chicken and waffles came with 4 crispy fried chicken tenders with a pecan waffle with lots of candied pecans and savory green onions on top. I was surprised at how delicious it was. The chicken was so juicy and the breading was both sweet and peppery.  Fun additional that they have 3 different flavors of syrup: Traditional Maple, Vanilla and Bourbon. Maybe a label on the bottle would encourage guests to try them?  Hopefully they will spruce up the space a bit. When I visited the space was obviously still under construction and needed finishing (although I learned that they had been open for a few months?!). The orange walls as is are overpowering. Hopefully soft layered decor elements will be brought in to break it up, to offer a more inviting atmosphere.

RuP05jCA02gDst800bqLZA.text: Service was decent, food was not.  The blueberries in my crepe were awful - and I love blueberries. They were tough, and seemed that they were thawed versus fresh.  Food was also cold when it arrived.  Will not be going back unfortunately.

4REKTg3gfksQq5KfMU6Ibg.text: I'm so happy that downtown has a new brunch restaurant!  Living downtown we are a bit limited in brunch choices that are in walking distance.  My boyfriend and I came here on a very busy Sunday but Yelp has a check-in option so you can get your name on the list prior to arrival.  We had about a half hour wait.  Once seated we were promptly greeted by our server.  I did a build your own waffle and put about everything on it!  My boyfriend ordered the chicken and waffles.  Both of our dishes were great.  I do wish my waffle had a been a little hotter but still the taste was wonderful.  Our servers was very friendly and helpful.  We will definitely come back and bring others!

It was filled with veggies and cheese and topped with feta cheese and a chipotle drizzle. Usually I add hot sauce to my omelettes but this was so flavorful it wasn't needed. zJ48EGKq89IJznfQtfHDlA.text: Must have patience. It seems like they are short staffed and took about 40 mins or so to get our food but it was worth it! I had the breakfast magic, and he's put syrup on it! The waffle was no soggy, I got my egg over hard! It was a great little find while we were staying down town!

9cdZuqjKxveD1YqjEn8CwA.text: Waffles INCaffeinated offers a huge range of selections - some great, some okay, and a few that I think needs a little bit of reworking. Their waffles are solid, but I feel that way at best and at the end of the day, a simple waffle cannot get better without changing up the recipe a bit. As a result I felt that the waffles were a bit plain and did not match some of the dishes as well as they could have. For example, perhaps adding little chunks of salt crystals in the waffles to complement the friend chicken in "chicken and waffles" (just an idea...). Their "funky monkey" waffles comprises peanut butter, chocolate sauce, and bananas on waffles which overall is a great, but the huge lob of peanut butter was placed on the waffle in a big clump. Because their peanut butter was rather pasty, it was difficult to spread it around and made the dish slightly tedious to eat and imbalanced. One suggestion is to add ice cream to vary textures e.g. peanut butter ice cream and chocolate sauce or vice versa.  I think they're 3 greatest highlights are 1) their syrups 2) fried potatoes and 3) service was amazing! The syrups are simple and flavors really stand out! And for the fried potatoes....they are probably my favorite thing on their entire menu (to be fair I really enjoy carbs). The exterior is fried to a crisp, but the interior is still light and fluffy, almost like potato puffs.  Overall, if I wanted a solid waffle this would be the place I'd go, but this isn't something that I crave often.

qGWnplxveayqBfItyyTmsw.text: Table for 4. Kind of slow service but we came during marathon weekend. Food was great - good portions, not bad prices. Didn't try a waffle unfortunately! Would def go again.

0qZZ8UwDVxlz8dC7sSG5lQ.text: Had an awesome waiter who was really conscientious and the food was quite good. The vegetarian omelette was awesome. Hubby had the BALT sandwich, also quite good. jYZ8fUAme4RwPMVuTWtV_g.text: Holy shitballs!   1st call ahead or put your name on the waitlist that is on yelp because this place is JUMPIN!   Omg!  I don't think I've had a better breakfast than this!  They have sooo many options, literally you can create a pineapple cheesecake waffle with strawberry drizzle!  They have savory options as well!  A cornbread waffle with GUMBO?!? What in the actual fuck?!?  Delish!  Food came out pretty quick considering they were quite busy!!! fO8ElsT8utozMsdA-Wsc6w.text: One of the best things about eating in Pittsburgh is this online waitlist option they have on Yelp. No joke. If not for that, I'm not sure I'd be down to try popular places like Waffles, INCaffeinated, even tho I have absolutely stood in line for longer periods. But I digress.  One of the best things they have on this menu is the goat cheese. Creamy, delicious goat cheese. As far as I'm concerned every menu should include goat cheese. Well at Waffles, INCaffeinated, you can get a mushroom and chevre omelette...so I did. I added red onion and spinach and I was in omelette heaven. I paired this delightful omelette with home fries, and it comes with a slice of roasted tomato. The home fries are a-freakin-mazing, made up of carrots, sweet potatoes, regular potatoes, and green peppers, every last bite of these fries is like a gift. I followed it all up with half a waffle - yes, you can get a half a waffle here! Is that inspired or what? Well I'll tell you what's inspired - these amazingly light; crispy waffles. I am pretty sure I've never had waffles that light before - at home or out in a restaurant. Well, you pair that with their bourbon sauce and you are dancing on the ceiling. No joke. Coffee here is also a nice solid dark roast, which wraps this meal up with a big fat ribbon. Get it!  The staff here are run off their feet - it's so popular! - but they remain pleasant and efficient, which as a patron I absolutely appreciate.   Honest to god if I ever come back to this town I'm coming back here. Totally worth the calories!

8Jl_ZM6vm0y1BVxGo8Za9g.text: Oh, seriously. This was my 2nd time here, the first being a Yelp Elite event. Both times the service was efficient and pleasant and the food was delectable in presentation and taste.  I got the funky monkey waffle with bananas and chocolate both times. So worth it!

szp3BaAqSLgbL8FmqJpceQ.text: Atmosphere - just OK. located in a portion of the former Kaufmann's store, the restaurant has an modern, almost industrial, feel. We were greeted promptly and seated at a 4 top. The restaurant is fairly small, with about 15-20 4 tops. The one wall is all glass, which makes the restaurant bright. Chairs are molded plastic.  Service - average. Our server was not overly attentive and we kept having to ask for things.  Food - very good. Although the restaurant has a focus on waffles, Omelettes and French Toast are two of a few alternative offerings. I ordered a waffle with "blueberry sauce", which I enjoyed. The waffle was light and airy. Coffee is served in small (6 oz?) mugs, so we were frequently asking for a refills.   Value - average. Breakfast came to over $30 for two. Which is a little steep considering the limited amount of food ordered.

photos.caption: Photo of Waffles, INCaffeinated - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

GZJbaA8b-h3BhUly1HRj3w.text: I have been to the original location but happy to see they expanded downtown. This space is bigger than the other one so it can accommodate more people. They are also on the no wait application, so you can put your name on the waiting list ahead of time. If your venturing out to come to this location, it might be difficult to find parking.   Waffles, INCaffeinated is known for their waffles but they have other options as well. Their staple side is their potato wedges. I got the mushroom omelette with the multi colored wedges. It was good and I felt like it was not too heavy. If you do want a waffle, they are customizable for a savory or sweet touch.   They also offer different coffee options that you can customize by adding flavor options.

photos.caption: Photo of Waffles, INCaffeinated - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mushroom omelette

g2xRvKVoComJXnXpo3E61w.text: First stop in Pittsburgh! They had me at waffles! I was super excited to try this place out! Their menu looked amazing.   Ordered the Chicken and Waffles and the Vegetarian Delight with Egg Whites. Boy, I gotta tell you the waffles... YUM! I love that the taste of syrup was in each bite of the waffle and it was delicious. However, they added too many pecans to the dish. The chicken batter was great as well, you could taste the sweet savory-ness of the maple butter glaze and it worked well with the waffles. The only issue was that the chicken was very dry. The vegetarian delight was decent. The potatoes that came with the dish were inconsistently cut and cooked. Some were crispy and some were just soggy. There was an excessive amount of feta on the omelet. The roasted tomatoes looked great but they tasted very cold.

XiruBd2GV-_CJ5OUF04g3A.text: There aren't many good breakfast places in downtown on a Saturday morning so we were happy to find this cute place.   I LOVE orange, and this place is painted orange, so naturally I was happy from the start.     There are only about 20 tables, but at 9:00 on a Saturday it was packed.   Our server was decent, not great.  I ordered a decaf coffee and the coffee was excellent!!!!   Wish they used a bigger cup, as I had to keep tracking our server down for a refill.  It's probably the smallest cup I have ever seen in a restaurant.  The menu is varied, and of course there are waffles of every kind, with any kind of topping you can think of.   I opted for a BLT, which also had avocado.   It was served with chips, sprinkled with something.    The sandwich was good, not great.  The food came hot and looked nice.   I saw many other plates and everything looked yummy.    Would definitely return.  Also, if you use the yelp app, you can do an on-line check in for a spot in line.

u4CYJ7oCXo2BGLH93wI0rw.text: Made it to the third Waffles location in the city this past weekend. They were super busy and right on the route for the Pride Parade. I noticed that it took a lot longer to get our food that day than the usual fast service from Waffles Inc, but nonetheless everyone loved what they ordered. The signature cappuccinos were the hit for the table.  I had the Southern Waffle, covered in Sausage Gravy. Wish I would have paired it with a bowl of fruit to help cut down the richness of it. Loaded with sausage though and great flavor. Never been disappointed with a meal from here.

Photo of Waffles, INCaffeinated - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sausage Gravy Waffle

sQoDQY5oDpzLIHwCmzsjGQ.text: I had no knowledge of the fact that there was a restaurant in Downtown Pittsburgh that served the ubiquitous soul food dish of Chicken and Waffles.  That is until two friends of mine said that they almost killed themselves by stuffing their faces at Waffles INCaffeinated.  What????  Waffles INCaffeinated?  I pass the place at least 4 days a week on my way home from work and for some reason, I just assumed that it was a coffee house. I already have a rotation of coffee houses that I frequent and I didn't feel the need to add a new one to the rotation.  So, I was surprised to find out that this "coffee house" was actually Waffles INCaffeinated.  So when I followed up on a lunch date that I promised a friend of mine, I suggested this restaurant.  My friend ordered the CHICKEN AND WAFFLE  - A Southern classic consisting of a pecan infused waffle with boneless, thick breaded, fried chicken pieces coated with a maple butter glaze and topped with scallions.  I ordered the Caprese Crab omelet with Juicy tomato, fresh mozzarella, basil, crab, and is garnished with black pepper.   I also had onions and mushrooms added to my omelet and had wheat toast with it.  Both dishes were delicious.  In fact, my friend couldn't finish the Chicken and Waffles. (He said that the dish didn't look that big on the menu and he can throw down when it comes to food.)  I, on the other hand cleared my dish and I was so glad that the omelet had a decent amount of lump crab meat. (I hate when some places open up a can of mystery crabmeat or worse, that fake wannabe surimi crabmeat.  Yech!)  My only complaint is that our waitress didn't tell me that the addition of mushrooms and onions was almost $5 and that service was a little slow.  Other than that, everything was what one of my great-nieces calls "Easy Peasy".  So, if you have a taste for all day breakfast/brunch food and you're in Downtown Pittsburgh, please check them out.

photos.caption: Photo of Waffles, INCaffeinated - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken and Waffles!

NUIt8d1b2asMJIImp2OkAw.text: Love this place, not only because they make delicious waffles, but they offer such a wide variety! The life saver for me is they offer gluten free waffles. And I swear to you, I cannot tell the difference between the regular one, prior to being GF.  I always want to go with the sweet and totally indulge, but I am usually here for breakfast, so I straddle the middle. I love getting raspberries inside the waffle with coconut flakes and their house made vanilla syrup. Super simple, but delicious. I also enjoy their crab Benedict waffle as well, if you want a more savory option.   Honestly, there's so many options to choose from. Between the house made creations to make your own, you could probably come up with hundreds of concoctions.   I love the fact that they're on wait list, so you can reserve your spot from your phone via the Yelp app during the busiest times. This spot is slightly hidden in the new Kaufman's building development, but so worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Waffles, INCaffeinated - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Very Berry Gluten Free Waffle

XLVDm08ygkAH96j1ATS7wQ.text: I was downtown anyway and was in the mood for a waffle. I had a mega berry waffle. The service was excellent and super fast. The waitress was extremely friendly and upbeat. I do not particularly care for the location as it is hard to park. If you are downtown anyway and nearby it is definitely worth a trip. I personally prefer the other locations of Waffles Inc that are not downtown as there is no parking issues.

photos.caption: Photo of Waffles, INCaffeinated - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

R1AnErT5qeOUdGqAJ4X0JA.text: So good. We arrived around 9:30 on a Sunday morning before the crowd hit, but we got one of the last available tables. It fills up pretty fast. Service was fairly quick and we had coffee in no time. I opted for the Megaberry and my husband got the chicken and waffle. Both were excellent, though my husband was wishing for dark meat chicken instead of breast. My berry waffle was loaded with fruit and a generous supply of whipped cream. Portions here are not shy.

sD8rV3tJ38HIkzJ8MsGFyw.text: Food was good service was okay the waitress gave me some attitude for no reason and I was coming there as my first breakfast after dieting for my Bikini competition for 6months so I really wanted to have a delicious meal and a good time. To be honest her attitude cause them to loose a star and the food was good but not amazing. They do have some awesome choices and the waffles were really yummy! Overall average experience but good waffle! That waffle was the highlight!

photos.caption: Photo of Waffles, INCaffeinated - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Banana peanut butter waffle

3FTjrrbjhXati8_6nl4JTw.text: Excellent breakfast spot!! So unique in the old Kauffman building!! Cannot wait for this to be a staple breakfast location to the revitalization of that area in downtown.  Same great quality as their other locations, with some new menu options, like the gumbo waffle and flight of waffles!! Can be a little more expensive for breakfast, but the portions are good sized and the food is delicious!!  Really good service and quality!!

Photo of Waffles, INCaffeinated - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

HpZvhoIDb9Gg67ImGiGJdA.text: Wow,  this place is a hidden gem!!!!!if in Pittsburgh make sure you visit; service was quick, food excellent!!!  This is the kind of small business that defines a city.  Only thing is the store front blends in and hard to see.. but worth the search

photos.caption: Photo of Waffles, INCaffeinated - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Peach Waffle with bacon

bjVAHF5wXHoMqUwjODgEdQ.text: Soooooo delicious. I had the BC breakfast with the half waffle and had zero regrets. Such huge portions we didn't even need lunch!  We arrived after 1030 on a Thursday and there was no wait. We were quickly seated and our server brought waters. Our server was friendly and quick to bring requested items. Prices are completely reasonable for the portion sizes.  The home fries come with multiple varieties of potato which was awesome! Mushrooms as a side brought me abundant joy!  100% recommend this place if you're in downtown Pittsburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of Waffles, INCaffeinated - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Cq0FQuUifv9VptXIKnnfzw.text: RUN FROM THIS PLACE IF YOU HAVE CELIAC DISEASE!   This place claimed to serve us gluten free waffles and instead delivered regular waffles to our table which we ate and ended up going to the emergency room.  After weeks of trying to contact the owner he continues to ignore me rather than accept the fact the fact that they made a mistake and own it.

Rbo6o9pwvnBi-JvOt3AxBA.text: Great service and delicious food!!! The country Benedict was amazing!!!! The chicken and gravy are individually and collectively a whole MEAL by themselves. Lol. Don't skip this!  Perfect for breakfast or brunch if you're staying downtown. Less than 7 min walk from the Omni William Penn Hotel.

photos.caption: Photo of Waffles, INCaffeinated - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Country Benedict

nkTPlX_1NrIlhfkSbGyT6w.text: Loved their selection! Great service and presentation. Will visit again next time I am in town

PGc5Q4oTMgRUhZgppFC1mg.text: The BEST home fries I have ever had! Eggs over easy perfectly cooked. Fruit salad tasted like the actual fruit. Good coffee. The daughter and I are in town for college visits and glad we wandered in.

bw187LQd452qMwLzfekOAA.text: If you're going to make waffles your prime ingredient, they ought to be good.  I was there for lunch last week and ordered the waffle and chicken.  Everything was room temperature.  The waffle was soggy.  The chicken was clearly previously frozen chicken tenders from a food service company that had been fried up earlier in the day and then sat under a heat lamp.  Breading had fallen off in places and the exposed chicken underneath was dry and crusty.  I couldn't cut some pieces with a knife. Our server never checked back to see if everything was okay.  We waited so long for our lunch, I assumed everything was freshly made, but that clearly was not the case.  By the time we got our food, there would have been not enough time to have my lunch freshly made and get back to the office before my lunch hour was up, even if our server had bothered to check back on us.  Since this is not a "two martini, expense account" type of restaurant, they need to step up their game to get the rest of us working folk in and out with a decent lunch, because this food is not cheap.

-F57kvW6bmuk4ZJpoFfIXw.text: Visiting Pittsburgh and needed breakfast on Sunday morning. Since this place was right around the corner from hotel- and because another review stated this restaurant's veggie omelette was the best she'd ever had - we gave it a shot. Hubs had bacon and eggs with roasted tomatoes (also a pile of potatoes and rye toast). I couldn't help but try the veggie omelette (and I should note that in the almost 20 years I've been a pescatarian, I've eaten A LOT of veggie omelettes). Everything came out piping hot and was delicious! And the veggie omelette....drumroll....the best I've ever had! It is a delicious array of veggies, feta, and a yummy sauce on top which had just the right amount of spice! It was absolutely amazing! So between the great food (hubs was also quite pleased) and the terrific service (everyone and especially our server Jack was super friendly), this place is a winner!

vzWVqPKWlIJELJaFXpXoYQ.text: big variety of breakfast food - not just waffles! although- their chicken and waffles is really good! always a wait on the weekend so use the app!! lattes are also amazing

PLhwGdDYL0Nq3audoTeIKQ.text: Good gluten free options and a lot of fun and interesting foods to try here. Not the best waffle I've ever had, but I've been here a few times and won't hesitate to go back.

7yGHxwBA1NTiQ5iWUMdpVg.text: Essentially a diner. Very good service and an excellent veggie omelet along with decent wheat toast for once. Atmosphere/decor is a bit odd but solid place for breakfast or brunch.

ZdDINqnId2RCzeKyGQOyZw.text: Food and service was great.  We split the Crab Omelette, country mile sandwich and a desert waffle between 4 of us.  All was great but Sandwich was the best with the mushrooms.

uHtpnvafYPPDNqww3POZEg.text: What a great place!! Been wanting to try it for a while now, and now that one's open closer to where I live, the hubby and I ventured out to try it. Hubby had the Funky Monkey waffle with the vanilla syrup, and I had the BC breakfast,with my choice of meat(bacon), toast and two sides. I highly recommend the sauteed mushrooms and the home fries. Both were seasoned very well, and not too heavily. Our server was wonderful and made great suggestions as to the sides, as I wouldn't have tried the home fries without her suggestion. All in all, a great experience, and we will go back.

vGxf7ZYVcdWWE8e7ACyGeg.text: My crepes were delicious and the coffee wasn't too bad! (I'm a coffee snob so I appreciate when a diner has a decent cup)

taFCUNmP7W9wK6_7VJMCEw.text: Got the country Benedict. Chicken was like frozen chicken tenders and seemed over cooked, waffle was extremely mushy (even parts untouched by gravy) and the sweet flavor in it was offputting. A completely  savory and crunchy waffle would be better. Gravy was ok but not great. Pretty expensive for what you get too (half a waffle, two chicken tenders, two eggs -- $30 for two people). Service also slow even though not that busy.

lfkP0tdyZHNjGFlaOTmUiQ.text: Great food and service!  Recommend the chicken & waffles.  Will be dining here again for sure!

yTObi2JPt3IsHxISVHD-RQ.text: Olga and the crew here are always attentive, courteous and keep the coffee coming!  We love this place! Our two kids, 5 & 7 always make "happy plates" and I have never been disappointed with the quality or flavors. It's going to take me a few visits to eat through the menu but I will always have a side of that incredible sausage gravy!

SoQYvjPBdaHJWuKYc3qfmw.text: We were quickly seated by friendly staff!  The wait staff were extremely attentive and personable.  The food was fantastic (as I've grown to love from other locations).  Relatively fast service as we were in and out (normal time)...but with plenty of time to hit our matinee at the Benedum.  (2/3/19)

photos.caption: Photo of Waffles, INCaffeinated - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Benny

JyN71NBdE6axvis3EUSTxQ.text: Not from Pittsburgh and here for a baseball game. Food was okay, but nothing rave about. I have been here for 3 days and the one thing I've noticed is, don't come here if you're a minority couple because you'll be stared at like animals. Attitude from people is the norm and is also applicable to waiters/waitresses.

TMdIq2upwM3-gQVZNHl22g.text: Strange atmosphere. Waited over an hour after ordering. Just 2 waffles. Nothing special, still hungry. Would not recommend.

rw50oQw0i9E28vzKIOfBBA.text: Overpriced and average food at best.  My friend and I went for lunch.  I had the funky monkey waffle as it was the special that day.  Would have ordered something else, however I like to keep my lunches at around the $10-$11 mark at most...unless it's a special occasion, and most items on the menu were over $10.  The waffle was ok.  Probably too much chocolate as it was very sweet.  They had three choices of syrups that had the consistency of water.  My friend had the BLT.  The bacon didn't look like it was just cooked.  My guess is that it was leftover from breakfast.  The chips that came with it were soggy with grease.  The waitress offered to replace them with properly cooked chips, but my friend declined.  I would not return.  The greasy smell of my clothing, due to poor ventilation, reminded me of that all day.

cQQULnGHndOZtatM1OGd8g.text: Service was great and everyone was very friendly. It's in a great location close to all in the center of town.  The food was excellent!  My daughter is 6 and loved her meal!  Will be back and would suggest if in doubt of where to go ... give this location a try.  You will be glad you did!

TmDEZXSsgLk6RhSfy7DkTw.text: Best waffles I've had in a long while. Also, top notch service! Coffee delicious, every plate that we ordered (party of 7) was extremely delicious!!

Qd5RQs6XDFwHzpqUy-r3Xw.text: They have dairy/soy/gluten free waffles that are amazing!! Having food allergies it is hard to go out to eat and I was so pleased with Waffles incaffeinated. They are very accommodating, they also offer vegan waffles. I would highly recommend stopping in here for a tasty breakfast.

0G9lJTI400QKOGu6lcS3_A.text: I stopped at this place for breakfast when I had a couple hours to kill before leaving town. I went on a Friday morning and it wasn't busy; I was seated immediately. The place was clean and I thought the menu to be reasonably priced. I got the Funky Monkey, a waffle with chocolate chips and chocolate drizzle paired with sliced bananas on top. Normally, it's 11.30 but there was some promotion on Fridays that made it only $6! That was a pleasant surprise considering it was a sizable waffle. I only had to wait about 10 minutes for it to come out too. The wait staff was friendly and fast. I would definitely recommend eating here to anyone finding themselves downtown.

kyWNHK7SqY150gOR8vvNUg.text: Very nice restaurant. The waitress was quick and was pretty excited to learn that it was the first time we visited the restaurant.  My boyfriend and I had the funky monkey and chicken &waffles which were delicious.  Very good and very filling. The staff was pleasant and friendly.  Can't wait to visit again the next time we are in town.

EI-dt1p6dxhKfKQjhX7V2Q.text: This is the second location we have been to, this one seemed very unfinished. Sat us in a corner table with brooms behind us and a ladder beside us. Our server Jack was super nice but seemed to have to large of section with a hard time keeping up. Not his fault at all. Food was great but this spot seemed very unfinished and not well thought out. Like the had opened regardless of not having set up properly.

DVqCV30Hr1L5FybhaBCQww.text: These were the best waffles I've ever eaten..  We all had several types of waffles.  The Benny and the fosters were very delicious.  We will be back!

E_yqIK4cZsC54ypCpTnDOQ.text: The food was SO good. I got the breakfast tacos & they were a completely different take on breakfast, but it worked so well. A very unique/quirky atmosphere & the server was very friendly
